image.altText: A little girl wearing a headband with colours of the Aboriginal flag sits on a man's shoulders at a rally

props.synopsis: The first drop of Closing the Gap target data for 2024 provides updates for eight of the 19 socio-economic targets, showing the agreement is not on track.

title.children: Latest Close the Gap data shows only five out 19 targets are 'on track'. Will the next generation get a ‘fair go’?

image.altText: A composite image shows photographs of a woman with a magnifying glass over one photo.

props.synopsis: The suspected homicide of a woman with disabilities is raising questions about how her disappearance slipped through the cracks.

title.children: Tanya Glover vanished. No-one reported her missing. 13 years later, her body was found

image.altText: A woman sits at her table in front of an iPad.

props.synopsis: Retirement living advocates say the number of older Canberrans will increase by 75 per cent in the next two decades, and more needs to be done to accommodate them in housing and health.

title.children: Current housing infrastructure won't cope with 'silver tsunami' of older Canberrans, advocates say

subjects.title: Assisted Living and Long Term Care

image.altText: Three children sit with their hands cable tied. Their faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: Roger Cook says vision appearing to show children being cable tied together in the state's north is "disturbing" and "confronting" while the state's Children's Commissioner says she is "appalled" by the allegations.

title.children: WA's premier 'disturbed' by confronting vision of kids cable tied together in state's north

image.altText: Donald Trump stands infront of a United States flag wearing a suit at a podium.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Joe Biden secured major victories in most state races. But trouble lies ahead for both men in the lead up to November's election. These were today's key takeaways.

title.children: An 'amazing day' for Donald Trump and a surprise loss for Joe Biden: What you need to know about Super Tuesday

image.altText: A woman writes well messages on the message board during the tenth annual remembrance event at a shopping mall.

props.synopsis: New deep-sea technology and different crash theories will be used as two more companies undertake bids to find the wreckage of doomed flight MH370.

title.children: 'Extremely rough terrain' flagged as new search area for MH370

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: People walk through the Chadstone Shopping Centre

props.synopsis: Australia's economy "limps along", but the "tepid" GDP growth at the end of 2023 again fails to keep up with a booming population, extending a deep per capita recession.

title.children: 'Unnecessary rate hike' plunges Australia's economy deeper into per capita recession

image.altText: A wide shot of five men in suits and ties standing in a line, crossing their arms and joining hands while smiling

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and South-East Asian leaders endorse a declaration that omits some language on China that Australia originally wanted included.

title.children: Australia and South-East Asian nations endorse watered-down declaration to strengthen regional ties

image.altText: Shane Drumgold out the front of the ACT courts.

props.synopsis: ACT Attorney-General Shane Rattenbury says Shane Drumgold's success in challenging some findings made against him during an inquiry into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution does not affect the report's recommendations.

title.children: ACT attorney-general says report into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution remains valid, despite successful challenge

image.altText: Roshni Lad laying on a hospital bed wearing a pink shirt with her husband Bhairav beside her.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne couple say they were "praying to God" for the safe delivery of their baby after being forced to pull over on the side of the road to give birth amid traffic chaos they say was caused by a climate protest on Tuesday.

title.children: Baby boy born on side of busy Melbourne road amid climate protest which caused traffic delay

image.altText: former prison officer wayne astill sits outdoors at a cafe table

props.synopsis: Minister for Corrections Anoulack Chanthivong said a "broken culture" permitted Wayne Gregory Astill to commit sexual offences against inmates during his time working at Dillwynia Correctional Centre.

title.children: More than 30 recommendations made to fix Sydney 'viper pit' prison where former guard sexually assaulted inmates

image.altText: The Bankwest logo outside its Perth building.

props.synopsis: Bankwest is set to close 60 branches across Western Australia, with 15 locations in regional communities to be converted to CBA banks.

title.children: Union slams 'outrageous' decision by Bankwest to close all 60 branches across WA

image.altText: The back of a brown-haired woman standing on the footpath along a street.

props.synopsis: Health provider Wesley Mission is planning to shut down its Kogarah and Ashfield hospitals, which provide mental health treatment. The news has shocked patients and staff.

title.children: 'It could cost lives': Patients and staff 'devastated' as two Sydney mental health hospitals set to close

image.altText: A vector illustration of blue, red and grey lines laid over spherical glowing 3D world map on plain black background.

props.synopsis: The internet powers almost every aspect of our modern life and is key for governments, intelligence agencies, and banks – and there's a worldwide struggle for control happening under the radar and under the waves.

title.children: China and the US are wrestling over a web of cables we never see, but rely on every day

image.altText: Black-and-white image of a swimming pool with people in Sydney Harbour.

props.synopsis: Billions of dollars need to be spent on repairing and replacing around 500 public pools over the next decade, so what does the future hold for the much-loved sporting and social hubs?

title.children: Australians are champion swimmers, but the pools they train in are closing

image.altText: A man upset while looking up. A hand placed on his shoulder in comfort.

props.synopsis: Court documents filed to the Adelaide Magistrates Court obtained by the ABC show police will allege Mr Dennis drove "recklessly or at a speed or in a manner which was dangerous to any person".

title.children: Professional cyclist Rohan Dennis to face court next week, charged with causing death of Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins

image.altText: John Armfield

props.synopsis: Former diver John Armfield has alleged at the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide that the ADF tried to discredit him when he sought counselling after receiving a report into the death of his brother.

title.children: 'They left me on my own': Former navy diver alleges the ADF tried to discredit him in Defence Royal Commission

image.altText: Sue and Lloyd Clarke

props.synopsis: The legislation is expected to come into force next year and will carry a maximum jail sentence of 14 years. The parents of Hannah Clarke say they will not stop fighting until it's criminalised nationwide.

title.children: Hannah Clarke's parents will not stop fighting until coercive control is criminalised across Australia

image.altText: A woman with braids stands half in a denim shirt against a grey backdrop.

props.synopsis: The UK advertising watchdog backtracks on its decision to ban the ad, following criticism from the public and the singer herself.

title.children: 'We got it wrong': Controversial ban of FKA twigs Calvin Klein ad partially lifted in UK

image.altText: Sign of International Criminal Court showing a set of scales inside a wreath.

props.synopsis: The International Criminal Court says there are reasonable grounds to believe two Russians were responsible for "missile strikes carried out by the forces under their command".

title.children: The International Criminal Court has issued arrest warrants for two Russian commanders. This is what we know

image.altText: Parachutes are seen low over the skyline of a city

props.synopsis: The US decision to start parachuting aid into the besieged Palestinian territory has many figures in the humanitarian and diplomatic sector deeply frustrated, writes Eric Tlozek.

title.children: Bombs and bread drop into Gaza, and the US has a hand in both

image.altText: A representation of bitcoin is seen in front of a stock graph and US dollar

props.synopsis: Crypto enthusiasts are celebrating, while cynics are describing this as the latest crash and burn cycle of a "zombie" asset that won't die.

title.children: Bitcoin hits a fresh record high, before the 'very volatile' asset plunges again

image.altText: Alex Prestney wearing a police uniform walking next to Belinda and Andrew Prestney outside court.

props.synopsis: A trucking boss avoids a prison term, despite allowing a drug-affected driver to get behind the wheel in the lead-up to Melbourne's Eastern Freeway tragedy where four police officers were killed.

title.children: 'Totally absurd': Family of police officer killed in freeway crash speaks after trucking boss spared jail

image.altText: Colourful illustrations of five beautiful women. All wear either a dupatta, chador, niqab, khimar or jilbab

props.synopsis: For Muslim women, wearing the hijab can bring a sense of pride, but it can also attract racism as misconceptions and assumptions prevail. So, let's set the record straight.

title.children: The question Muslim women dread every summer

image.altText: A woman with a blurred face entering a court with her lawyer.

props.synopsis: The court heard the woman found the girl "difficult to handle" but she had previously been convicted of child cruelty for similar treatment of another child in 2011.

title.children: Woman who starved and beat 5yo girl with a wooden spoon sentenced to jail

image.altText: Escalators at Carindale shopping centre busy with Christmas shoppers

props.synopsis: Whatever today's economic data shows about how close Australia is to recession the truth is we are already experiencing the biggest dive in living standards in half a century — and have been for two years, writes Peter Martin.

title.children: We're experiencing the biggest dive in living standards in half a century — and a recession is looming

image.altText: Taryn Brumfitt sitting on a towel in a timber sauna wearing black one-piece swimmers. She holds a book and smiles to the camera.

props.synopsis: Taryn Brumfitt describes her time as Australian of the Year for 2023 as a period of "saying yes and squeezing out every hour of every day". Upon reflection, prioritising rest was and continues to be essential.

title.children: Taryn Brumfitt wanted to spend less time on her phone, so she made this simple swap

image.altText: Nathan Murphy on the ground after a head knock in the 2023 AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: Children and adults who suffer a concussion playing community football will now have to sit out for at least three weeks, but the return-to-play protocols for AFL and AFLW players will remain at a minimum of 12 days.

title.children: AFL changes concussion guidelines for community football but elite-level protocols stay the same

image.altText: Daniel Ricciardo, in his racing suit, talking to a team member in their F1 garage.

props.synopsis: The opening race of the season for RB ended in controversy, with Tsunoda unhappy with being asked to move aside for Ricciardo who was on faster tyres.

title.children: RB need perfect race for points as Ricciardo looks to move on after calling teammate a 'helmet'

image.altText: Two loaves of bread on a supermarket shelf, one with blue and red label and one with a green label that says gluten free

props.synopsis: Whether it be gluten free, dairy free or lactose free, people with special dietary requirements are used to spending more at the supermarket checkout and the reasons are complex.

title.children: Why is gluten-free bread so expensive?

image.altText: The tail of a Qantas plane in front of a Qantas shed on a tarmac at an airport.

props.synopsis: A NSW District Court judge rules that Qantas acted illegally when it sidelined an employee after he raised safety concerns about COVID-19.

title.children: 'Heads have to roll': Senator calls for Qantas board resignations over worker court case

image.altText: William Shatner performing at the 25th Montreal Just For Laughs festival in 2007

props.synopsis: The Canadian company that operates the festival has taken the extreme moves in order to avoid bankruptcy.

title.children: Montreal's Just For Laughs comedy festival cancels 2024 event and lays off majority of staff
